tool.name: OTB.CompareImages
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayref.in False isArraymeas.in False output_data_mse $output_data_mse output_data_mae $output_data_mae output_data_psnr $output_data_psnr output_data_count $output_data_count name OTB.CompareImages ref.in $ref.in ref.channel $ref.channel meas.in $meas.in meas.channel $meas.channel roi.startx $roi.startx roi.starty $roi.starty roi.sizex $roi.sizex roi.sizey $roi.sizey ram $ram prefer $prefer response $response transmissionMode_mse $OutputSection_mse.transmissionMode_mse transmissionMode_mae $OutputSection_mae.transmissionMode_mae transmissionMode_psnr $OutputSection_psnr.transmissionMode_psnr transmissionMode_count $OutputSection_count.transmissionMode_count

param.name: ref.in
param.label: Image used as reference in the comparison
param.help: Image used as reference in the comparison The following data types are allowed in the txt file: jpeg, tiff, png

param.name: ref.channel
param.label: Used channel for the reference image
param.help: Used channel for the reference image

param.name: meas.in
param.label: Image used as measured in the comparison
param.help: Image used as measured in the comparison The following data types are allowed in the txt file: jpeg, tiff, png

param.name: meas.channel
param.label: Used channel for the measured image
param.help: Used channel for the measured image

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_mse
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

section.name: OutputSection_mae
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

section.name: OutputSection_psnr
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

section.name: OutputSection_count
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: This application computes MSE (Mean Squared Error), MAE (Mean Absolute Error) and PSNR (Peak Signal to Noise Ratio) between the channel of two images (reference and measurement). The user has to set the used channel and can specify a ROI.
